intro: Agassizia, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Mexico and Central America. The plants typically have showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. They are often found in woodland and shrubland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Agassizia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
